SEARCH
Package main.java.daos

Class OrderDAO

java.lang.Object
main.java.daos.OrderDAO
All Implemented Interfaces:
DAOInterface<Order>
public class OrderDAO extends Object implements DAOInterface<Order>
OrderDAO is implemented from DAOInterface OrderDAO is a Data Access Object (DAO) for managing Order objects with CRUD Operations. It provides methods to interact with Order data stored in Excel files.
Since:
23-Apr-2024
Version:
1.5
Author:
SDDA Team 1

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • readData

      public void readData()
      Reads data from Excel files and populates the orderList. If the files do not exist, it creates new Excel files. It keeps track of order time as well, keeping into mind the assumption that orders will be automatically cancelled (i.e. change order status to cancelled) once order time exceeds 2 hours. Handles IOException if encountered while reading or creating the files.
      Specified by:
      readData in interface DAOInterface<Order>

    • saveData

      public void saveData()
      Saves the data from orderList to Excel files. If the files do not exist, it creates new ones. Handles IOException if encountered while writing the files.
      Specified by:
      saveData in interface DAOInterface<Order>

    • getElements

      public List<Order> getElements()
      Returns the list of Orders stored in orderList.
      Specified by:
      getElements in interface DAOInterface<Order>
      Returns:
      List of Orders

    • findElement

      public Order findElement(String itemName)
      Finds and returns an Order by its ID.
      Specified by:
      findElement in interface DAOInterface<Order>
      Parameters:
      itemName - The Name of the Item to find, which is equivalent to the ID
      Returns:
      The found Order containing the Item inside, or null if not found

    • updateElement

      public void updateElement(Order oldElement, Order newElement)
      Updates an existing Order with new data.
      Specified by:
      updateElement in interface DAOInterface<Order>
      Parameters:
      oldElement - The old Order object to update
      newElement - The new Order object containing updated data
